title: Veigar needs a cap on his passive
body:
Because god damn this champion is unfair to play against come late game. I literally got one-shotted 25 minutes into my game because our mid, jungle and bot fed their asses off.

And I couldn't do anything about it because no matter how much magic resist, he will still be able to out damage anything.

He needs a cap on his passive because letting him continue to stack into over 1000 AP is beyond broken.

Please put this into effect, Riot, for the sake of all the players who have to play against this crap.

>Passive: Sion gains 4 maximum Health when he kills a unit (15 for champion kills, assists, large minions and large monsters).

Maybe you should plan your strategy around windows of strength rather than expecting to engage all the time.

Also, you might want to practice blocking Veigar's abilities. Playing a champ with a spellshield will give you more opportunities to do so. With time, you'll find that Veigar's playstyle is pretty predictable, and you'll be ready to block his kit with the push of a button.

And I can't play Morgana every time there's a Veigar, especially if I'm in a different lane. Again I was top lane. Doing fine on my own.

Then I get literally one shotted in the middle of the game because of this shit.

Morg's E isn't a spellshield. It's a shield that absorbs only magic damage, but prevents disables while it holds. Sivir and Nocturne have spellshields. Of course, a magic damage shield can also be enough to prevent lethal burst, or you could try a regular shield like Janna's, or a champ with an untargetable effect like Fizz/Vlad, or Kayle's invulnerability, and so on. It's just that Zhonya's is a pretty reasonable purchase for mages in general, so you don't have to be playing a specific champ for that to be available to you. It's just that champs who do happen to have an effect like that generally have access to them more often than you can use Zhonya's, so you can get more practice in.

Allow me to put your experience (full health to dead with one Veigar ult) into perspective. I play Veigar in Co-op vs AI. I go botlane and just stack my passive basically nonstop. If I do that really well, and get a few items, I start being able to cast W on a squishy (like Nid bot or something) and then Comet finishes them off. A few minutes later, I don't need Comet anymore. Note that that's with W, which does more damage than R when the target is at full health. To be able to kill a Kennen who's probably building a couple items with health and MR with a single ult cast before 30:00 would require an incredible amount of farm and items. It would basically require running in there repeatedly to intentionally give him stacks and gold, while protecting turrets to delay the end of the match.

Almost any champion fed to that degree would murder everything. This isn't a problem with Veigar, it's a problem with needing to report three of your teammates for trolling and inting.

Do you have a replay? Can you tell us how many stacks he had on his passive, how much total AP he'd managed, and what items he was using?

Veigar isnt broken. He had to earn his stacks throughout the game theres nothing wrong with that.
He doesn't deserve to get over a 1000 AP just for farming and to just one shot later even if he went 0-13 early. It's downright stupid and not fair to the people playing against him.

his attacks are entirely dodgable  also he doesnt gain 1000 ap from just farming his OMG ap it comes mainly from items 1st the stacks are just a bonus.  i had at least a death cap worth of ap or at most 200 and something it didnt call out to OMG proportions. his final base damages, item ap scaling is what makes him strong late game. the extra ap passive is nice though.  even his ult is dodgable if you alpha it or zhonyas it. i hate untargetable things that break the ult.

on his q stay near minions or if hes fed enough to q ult you wait till he qs you then zhonyas his ult then your team can follow up on him. his stun cage is his most powerful weapon in his arsenal avoid = majority of his damage or all of it i always play sylas with cleanse vs him so i can unstoppably attack him.

And my team was so shit they died before any engage could happen from us so I was the only one left and he still did that to me. Ugh.

well how much ap did he have exactly and what champ were you and did you have MR built and did he have pen? if you didnt have MR and he had pen and its late game finally is he fed hard with deathcap then yes you do deserve the one shot. look at his kda counter it gives you a idea how much ap he has off of killing off other players. every kill and assist he gets he gets 5 ap off them.

I didn't check how much he had because I was too busy trying to keep the game together for the team. But looking at my op.gg, Veig finished 17/6/13, and had a Protobelt, Ludens and Deathcap, with an Oblivion Orb and Sorc shoes.

So in AP, he has 608, plus the 18% magic penetration. Safe to say he was doing a shit ton of damage.

Most mages can barely reach 400. Veig is completely stupid and doesn't deserve this shit.

I was Kennen in the top lane. I had just finished my main two items of Protobelt and Zhonyas and was just starting to build MR when teamfight phase started early because mid and bot lane threw their lanes to shit.

It was mid game and he was already about 11 kills or so. And no, I don't deserve a one shot 20 minutes into the game just because a stupidly designed champ can get extra AP over the rest of the mages that can't.

he had 38 pen and 290 ap (without death cap buff) after its 406 deathcap included but his stacks must have been at least 150 (not calculated yet but its calculated by kills plus assists x 5 ap = 150 ap excluding any minion or champion hit stacking),
it equals 616 ap altogether if i added champs hit and minions farmed i would say it can easily hit above 700 (cannons give more ap btw),
unless hes a supporty role he wont be able to stack easily due to adc farming.  mid lane has way more of a reason to be a late game monster than a support. so yes i can see why he would oneshot someone with no MR no matter how bs it is.
 gathering storm is also a factor into it.  if you were in lighting rush form (maybe?) you would have survived i dont know his stat buffs in that form.

Again, it wasn't late game. The game ended before 30 minutes.

Kennen gets a few armor and MR in his E but again Veigar should not be one shotting this early in the game or anywhere period. Other mages have to use multiple spells to kill someone from full health.

I didn't think he was able to do that so I walked around his stun circle waiting for it to be done but he just pressed R and deleted me. 

Veigar needs a cap on his passive or his scalings nerfed. Either one.

capping his passive would kill the "forever scaling ap fantasy" riot laid out for him he starts small {{champion:45}} "is that a short joke" not a threat early due to his non lethal damage at the beginning but later in the game. his power grows eternally till either he grows so powerful he cant be controlled.  sion/chogath has the same concept but with health but chogath can grab as many stacks as he wants until he one shots champs except sion theoretically oh yeah buy titanic hydra if thats the case your health will be turned into damage using hydra. nasus has q skill damage upgrade per minion kill.

And that fantasy is downright stupid. He should only be allowed to scale to a certain degree and then he's finished.

Cho can't one shot because he doesn't build enough AP, and Sion only stacks health as well that doesn't do any added damage. 

Nasus can't one shot with a fed Q.

Veigar needs nerfs. Period.

Chogaths ult scales on hp too just that he scales on hp also. If you cap his passive that means something has to be compensated somewhere else im pretty sure majority of veigar mains love him due to his endless scaling and cage/ult. What your suggesting would kill the champion as a whole.
you mean the syndra treatment after max stacks like X% true damage on X skill? and increase stun time by X?

No, it wouldn't. It would make him more easier to play against but still let others who have more skill to continue stacking and show off how fast they can get to the max. Maybe have a thing where if you reach the max amount, Veigar gets something extra added to his kit or something but not let him get over 1000 AP for pretty much nothing.
